definition: to run away from trouble/to flee from calamity/to be a refugee
to escape/to run away/to flee
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold

sentences.english: Refugees from the realm of dreams whose minds are as sharp as their swords.
sentences.chinese: 梦境国度的逃难者，思想锋锐如利剑银刀。

sentences.english: However, up to now, they still respect Nong Zhigao as their hero who led their first ancestors to flee from calamity.
sentences.chinese: 至今他们仍视侬智高为带领始祖逃难的英雄来崇敬。

sentences.english: In the meantime, the steady stream of NorthKorean defectors continues to flow into Chiang Saen.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，源源不断的朝鲜逃难者继续涌向清盛。

sentences.english: Since escaping the Jingzhou catastrophe, I've been recuperating at Bao Hamlet.
sentences.chinese: 自荆州失陷，逃难在鲍家庄养病。

sentences.english: On a recent afternoon, a group of defectors could be seen eatinglunch.
sentences.chinese: 不久前的一个下午，还可以看到一群逃难者在吃午饭。

sentences.english: Mud houses are submerged, millions have fled.
sentences.chinese: 土坯房也被浸泡在水中，数百万人逃难。

sentences.english: Her husband, who was already ill, died during their flight.
sentences.chinese: 她那已经患病的丈夫死在了逃难的途中。

sentences.english: Saul chased after David, so he started life of outlawry.
sentences.chinese: 大卫被扫罗追杀，所以开始逃难的生涯。

sentences.english: And all they that fled from the evils, joined themselves to them, and were a support to them.
sentences.chinese: 还有逃难流亡的人都同他们联合，支持他们。

definition: to escape from a famine/to get away from a famine-stricken region
refuge/to take refuge/to seek asylum (political etc)
to flee/flight (from danger)/fugitive
supporting a wife and children/dragged down by having a family to feed
chaos of war
refugee
destitute and homeless (idiom); forced from one's home and wandering about/displaced
confusion of war/turmoil of war
to force into exile/to be exiled/in exile
disaster of war
to take refuge/to seek refuge from disaster
dragged down by having a family to feed
to run away to/to flee
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
to run away/to go into exile
to wander far from home
